newsitem.title: SPAIN: Viesgo sure profits will rise apace in '97.
newsitem.headline: Viesgo sure profits will rise apace in '97.

text.p: Spain's utility Electra de Viesgo expects to maintain profit growth in 1997 at levels similar to those of prior years, Vice Chairman Santiago Fernandez Placencia said on Monday.

"Despite the tariff reduction and the poor climate for the sector in the first months of the year, we can maintain the rhythm of earnings gains from other years," Fernandez said at the annual shareholders meeting.
In 1996, net benefit of the Viesgo group was 5,828 million pesetas, a rise of 13.6 percent over the prior year.
The annual shareholders meeting also approved a dividend of 125 gross pesetas, which will include the payment of a complementary payout of 65 pesetas a share on July 7.
